channel.title: Contents on The Expat Tech
channel.description: Recent content in Contents on The Expat Tech

item.title: About me
item.description: Hi everyone! I’ve been working in IT for a long time—my first experiences go all the way back to playing on Apple IIe computers in 1983. One of the first “skills” I picked up was learning how to turn single-sided, double-density 5.25” floppy disks into double-sided disks using nothing more than a hole punch. I’ll also admit that I got into BBSes mainly so I could download games over a 300-baud modem.

item.title: About Me
item.description: Hi everyone! I’ve been working in IT for a long time—my first experiences go all the way back to playing on Apple IIe computers in 1983. One of the first “skills” I picked up was learning how to turn single-sided, double-density 5.25” floppy disks into double-sided disks using nothing more than a hole punch. I’ll also admit that I got into BBSes mainly so I could download games over a 300-baud modem.

item.title: Build a Mac OS 15 Sequoia VM?
item.description:
Getting Started

How to create a MacOS 15 Sequoia VM in VMware

Over the years, I have noticed that a lot of people seem to have bought into the marketing of Apple and believe that the Mac is the best computer. Apple has won the marketing game just like Bose has done with speakers. Audiophiles say that if you want no highs or lows, you buy Bose! Most people just don’t seem to get that while Apple does provide a good product, they are overpriced for what they provide and it isn’t close to the value most Windows-based computers are. Yes, you can find value with Linux but most people are more comfortable with what they already have been using for years – Windows.

item.title: What brought me here?
item.description:
Well, what is this site?

I want to create a place where I can share the things I enjoy, the things I know well, and the things I’ve spent a lifetime immersed in. I know a lot about computers. I’m an American who lives part-time in Mexico, part-time in the U.S., and part-time all over the world. I’ve worked professionally as an IT technician for over three decades. I also know quite a bit about how to entertain yourself if you’re an indoor person who likes movies and TV shows.

item.title: SR-71 Specifications
item.description:
SR-71 Blackbird Specifications

General Characteristics
Crew 2
Length 107 ft 5 in (32.74 m)
Wingspan 55 ft 7 in (16.94 m)
Height 18 ft 6 in (5.64 m)
Wheel track 16 ft 8 in (5 m)
Wheelbase 37 ft 10 in (12 m)
Aspect ratio 1.7
Wing Area 1,800 sq ft (170 sq m)
Empty weight 67,500 lbs (30,617 kg)
Gross weight 152,000 lbs (68,946 kg)
Max takeoff weight 172,000 lbs (78,018 kg)
Fuel Capacity 12,219.2 US gal (46,255 L)
Powerplant 2× Pratt & Whitney J58

Performance
Maximum speed 1,910 kn (2,200 mph)
Maximum Mach Mach 3.3+
Ferry Range 2,824 nmi (3,250 mi)
Service Ceiling 85,000 ft
Rate of Climb 11,820 ft/min
Wing loading 84 lbs/sq ft

Notes

  • All dimensions approximate.
  • Weights are for typical operational configuration.
  • Speeds are maximum achievable under optimal conditions.
